title: Hong Kong drops its bid for the London Stock Exchange Group
text:
New York (CNN Business) Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing has dropped its bid to acquire the London Stock Exchange Group.

The takeover would have created the world's third-biggest stock exchange behind the New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq in terms of the value of companies listed on those markets, according to the operators' data.

HKEX HKXCF "Today, disappointingly, we announced our decision not to proceed with a firm offer for London Stock Exchange Group," said Charles Li, CEO of, in a blog post. "We still believe the strategic rationale for the combination of our two businesses is compelling and would create a world-leading market infrastructure group."

However, Li said pursuing a "combination of the two businesses would not be in the best interests of our own shareholders."
